review: Four of us wanted to share interesting videos on YouTube while hanging out in the family room.  We pulled out our various versions of iPhones and one person had a Nexus tablet (android).  Then we started casting videos up on the TV from our various devices.  It worked great!!!  What a nice way to share without crowding around a computer or tablet/phone.  Also works well from our windows desktop and iPad air.  So far we have used it mostly for Netflix and YouTube on our Samsung non-smart LCD TV.  We also have a Wii which has YouTube and Netflix on it, but the ability to cast from multiple devices and search with ease makes this product more useful in our household.
author: Anonymous "Mondeep"

review: Chromecast is a economical way to upgrade a non-smart TV into a smart TV.  It basically turns your TV into an output device so the video quality is going to no better than what it would be on your computer or smart phone.Easy to setup if you have Windows 7 or later.  Otherwise, you will need to add the Google Cast extension to your Chrome browser for your pre-Windows 7 operating system.  This was not stated in the instructions and can frustrate people with older Windows operating systems during initial setup.  Also, the instructions were tiny and hard to read.
author: Doug Jean
